ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.2_0: At that time monks were having blankets made every year.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.3_0: They kept on begging and asking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.6_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.7_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics have blankets made every year, begging and asking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.9_0: We only make blankets for ourselves every five or six years, even though our children defecate and urinate on them and they are eaten by rats.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.10_0: These Sakyan ascetics have blankets made every year, begging and asking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.12_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.13_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.14_0: “How can those monks act like this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.16_0: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.17_0: “Is it true, monks, that some monks have blankets made every year, begging and asking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.21_0: “... How can those foolish men have blankets made every year, begging and asking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.23_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.24_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.25.1_0: ‘If a monk has a new blanket made, he should keep it for six years.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.26_0: Whether that blanket has been given away or not, if he has another new blanket made in less than six years, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.27_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.1_0: At one time a certain monk at Kosambī was sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.2_0: His relatives sent him a message:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.4_0: When other monks asked him why,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.7_0: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.8_0: that a monk who has had a new blanket made must keep it for six years.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.9_0: I’m not able to take my blanket when I’m sick,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.10_0: And because I’m not comfortable without it,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.13_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.14_0: “Monks, I allow you to give a blanket-permission to a sick monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.15_0: And it is to be given like this.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.16_0: The sick monk should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.18_0: I’m not able to take my blanket when I travel.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.19_0: I ask the Sangha for a blanket-permission.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.20_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.22_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.23_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.24_0: The monk so-and-so is sick. He is not able to take his blanket when he travels.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.25_0: He is asking the Sangha for permission to use a blanket-permission.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.26_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give a blanket-permission to monk so-and-so.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.28_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.29_0: The monk so-and-so is sick. He is not able to take his blanket when he travels.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.30_0: He is asking the Sangha for permission to use a blanket-permission.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.31_0: The Sangha gives a blanket-permission to monk so-and-so.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.32_0: Any monk who approves of giving monk so-and-so to a blanket-permission should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.33_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.34_0: The Sangha has given monk so-and-so a blanket-permission to monk so-and-so.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.35_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.37_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.38.1_0: ‘If a monk has a new blanket made, he should keep it for six years.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.39_0: Whether that blanket has been given away or not, if he has another new blanket made in less than six years, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.2_0: newly made is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.4_0: it is made by strewing, not by weaving.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.6_0: has made or has had made.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.7_0: He should keep it for six years:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.8_0: he should keep it for a minimum of six years.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.11_0: That blanket has been given away:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.14_0: Those who don’t give rise to anyone,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.15_0: Except if the monks have agreed:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.16_0: If he makes another new blanket, or has one made, unless the monks have agreed, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.17_0: When he gets the robe-cloth, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.18_0: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.19_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.21_0: ‘Venerables, this blanket which I have had eradicated more than six years, is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.22_0: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.25_0: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.26.1_0: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.27_0: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.28_0: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.29_0: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.30.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.31_0: if he makes one after six years;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.32_0: if he makes one after more than six years;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.33_0: if he makes one, or has one made, for the sake of another;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.34_0: if he obtains what was made by another and then uses it;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.35_0: if she makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.38_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.39_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on six years, is finished.
